channel.title: Just a note:
channel.description:
Guys, well, moderators, when you lock a topic because it is copy and paste, leached or any of the sort, shouldn't you modify the post so people can't see it? Because people can still follow the tutorial, and most likely will rep the poster...
Nomsain?

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:16, topic:205444”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=271119.msg2239564#msg2239564 date=1211598230]
Good to see Thug-life doing it… Casey. still isn’t
[/quote]
I will get on it!
Sorry about my negligence![/quote]
Read lothys post, his way makes sense.

Read full topic

Good to see Thug-life doing it… Casey. still isn’t

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I personally wouldn’t bother removing it unless you remove the whole topic (so in other words, I wouldn’t bother with just editing it).
What I used to do, and still do, is lock the topic, issue a form of warning, and leave it.
In a day’s time or so I then go back and remove all of the old locked topics.

It’s effective, it minimises clutter, and it gives the user a fair chance to see that the topic has been locked and the reason that they have been warned for, should one exist.

However, I think it would be great if warning someone quoted the message that they wrote and the warning we give them when sending them the PM. This would be better because then immediate removal of troublesome posts and topics is completely possible.

Read full topic

@Greeny wrote:

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

To be honest, can you start actually edited or even removing the topic? If the user wants to posts reasons as to why it should be unlocked, we can delete it. People are still reading tutorials which are locked and repping the poster.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Sounds good.

And even if ThugLife needs help with it or something I’m sure we have a few programmers in the staff who would be able to help.

Edit - ThugLife: Sorry i didn’t actually mean to click edit on your post, didn’t notice till after i pressed save. Sorry :o

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

No but i don’t think it would be hard to make, i might have a go later.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Sounds like a good idea, actually. Locking it does really nothing at all except allowing no further posts to be made. That doesn’t mean that they still can’t be repped for it.

A question out of curiosity: is there a mod that can be installed not permitting reputation/karma to be given when a topic is closed/locked? (That’s my creative side, heh. :D)

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I suppose, i have done it on a few threads but most of the time i left the tutorial there for a while incase the poster wanted to ask me why so i could provide proof and if they wanted to save it for another forum etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:5, topic:205444”]I just made myself the biggest bacon & egg sandwich. You wonder why? Well i found a bit of bacon at the back of the fridge. The morning before i had to use some honey soaked ham. Though it was nice, it wasn’t what i felt like. The day after a decided to book eggs for dinner, as i was very hungry and pizza would have taken an hour or so.

So anyway, i made the eggs and bacon and then flipped over the egg to make the yolk hard. You see, if it isn’t cooked, then it will drip everywhere and make the sandwich soggy. So you flip it over and wait 15 seconds. Even if it does drip, it turns hard on the base of the egg.

Once you have the eggs and bacon on a plate, put the bread in the toaster on a slightly lower level then usual. You really only want is slightly crisp. After all, the bacon will dry your mouth fairly easily. Put it all on the sandwich and add whatever you feel like. Pickles, Smoked BBQ sauce or tomato sauce are excellent options.

Whilst that is nice, i come up with something else that was just as tasty. You start off with a piece of bread and cut a big hole in the middle. Place the piece of bread on the fry pan and put the egg in the middle. Once 3 quarters of the center is hard, flip it over. Make sure to do this fast and not to move the egg from it’s position for 15 seconds or so. Once done, flip over and put it on a place. You should now have egg + toast in one. You can add bacon on top or leave it as it is.

@On-Topic: Was there not a thread like this before? Yes, i did type that all out myself.[/quote]
Oh god, perhaps I shouldn’t of pissed on that Tree after drinking, must of been Tree that I pissed on!

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

Thank you tree, we now know how to make bacon and eggs.[me=``jason]goes and tries tree’s recipe.[/me]

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

I just made myself the biggest bacon & egg sandwich. You wonder why? Well i found a bit of bacon at the back of the fridge. The morning before i had to use some honey soaked ham. Though it was nice, it wasn’t what i felt like. The day after a decided to book eggs for dinner, as i was very hungry and pizza would have taken an hour or so.

So anyway, i made the eggs and bacon and then flipped over the egg to make the yolk hard. You see, if it isn’t cooked, then it will drip everywhere and make the sandwich soggy. So you flip it over and wait 15 seconds. Even if it does drip, it turns hard on the base of the egg.

Once you have the eggs and bacon on a plate, put the bread in the toaster on a slightly lower level then usual. You really only want is slightly crisp. After all, the bacon will dry your mouth fairly easily. Put it all on the sandwich and add whatever you feel like. Pickles, Smoked BBQ sauce or tomato sauce are excellent options.

Whilst that is nice, i come up with something else that was just as tasty. You start off with a piece of bread and cut a big hole in the middle. Place the piece of bread on the fry pan and put the egg in the middle. Once 3 quarters of the center is hard, flip it over. Make sure to do this fast and not to move the egg from it’s position for 15 seconds or so. Once done, flip over and put it on a place. You should now have egg + toast in one. You can add bacon on top or leave it as it is.

@On-Topic: Was there not a thread like this before? Yes, i did type that all out myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a note:
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

Yz85Racer:

I know you do, but I think ThugLife and casey. don’t, I am not sure about `jason…

So far i have only locked a few tutorials and they were just common sense ones, for example one of them was saying to compile your server after edits, and that will fix all errors etc.

But i will change their post in future. Thanks.
